main event: A white, star-shaped object was observed for 12-20 minutes by a military witness near Condon, Oregon in July 1966.
interesting points: The object was observed moving rapidly to the right before suddenly turning left and appearing to move like a star.
The object remained at a constant distance from the witness for approximately 5 miles.
The witness reported the object disappeared after he went inside to call home.
The sighting was reported to the Air Force, who requested the witness complete an additional questionnaire.
Weather conditions at the time included a cloudy sky, winds up to 55 knots, and a ceiling of 25,000 feet.
